get.description:
| Field       | Type 
| ----------- | ---- 
| **----------- READ-ONLY -----------** | 
| `id`        | int64 
| `ver`       | int32 
| `etag`      | string 
| **---------- OPERATIONAL ----------** | 
| `created_at` | int64(epoch:milli) 
| `created_by` | lookup(user) 
| `updated_at` | int64(epoch:milli) 
| `updated_by` | lookup(user) 
| **---------- ATTRIBUTES -----------** | 
| `name`      | name! 
| `about`     | string 
| `labels`    | list[label!] 
| `emails`    | list[email!] 
| `photos`    | list[photo!] 
| `phones`    | list[phone!] 
| `managers`  | list[manager!] 
| `comments`  | list[comment!] 
| `addresses` | list[address!] 
| `languages` | list[language!] 
| `timezones` | list[timezone!] 
| `variables` | list[variable!] 
| `imclients` | list[imClient!]

parameters.name: page
size
q
parameters.description:
Search term:
`?` - matches any character
`*` - matches 0 or more characters
Used to query records within a set of `qin` fields, eg: name,emails{type},labels etc...

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort result dataset of records by fields.
```
sort ::= *( ORDER name )

ORDER  = ASC / DESC
DESC   = "-" / "!"
ASC    = [ "+" ]   ; Default
```

Fields available

- `id`(seq)
- `domain`{name}
- `created_at`
- `created_by`{name}
- `updated_at`
- `updated_by`{name}

Use ?fields=`field.sort()` option to sort Edge fields.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Fields [Q]uery to build result dataset record.
```
fields ::= field [ *( "," field ) ]
field  ::= name [ *( func ) ] [ inner ]
inner  ::= "{" fields "}"
funcs  ::= *( func )
func   ::= "." name "(" [ args ] ")"
name   ::= ALPHA / DIGIT / USCORE

ALPHA    = %x41-5A / %x61-7A  ; "A"-"Z" / "a"-"z"
DIGIT    = %x30-39            ; "0"-"9"
USCORE   = %x5F ; underscore  ; "_"
```

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Records with unique IDentifier(s).
Accept: `id` -or- `etag`.

parameters.name: qin
parameters.description:
[Q]uery[IN] is a set of search fields for term `q`.
Default: `name{common_name}`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
Source access mode requirement.

 - READ: Can `fetch` record. [GET]
 - WRITE: Can `update` record. [PUT|PATCH]
 - DELETE: Can `delete` record. [DELETE]

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: NEW Contact source changes

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Source Fields to return into result.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of result dataset records. offset = ((page-1)*size)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size count of records on result page. limit = (size+1)

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Search term: label.
`?` - matches any one character
`*` - matches 0 or more characters

primary.description: Indicates whether this phone number is default within other channels of the same type(phone).

verified.title:
Indicate whether Contact, as a Person, realy owns this associated phone number.
In other words: whether Contact is reachable thru this 'email' communication channel ?

type.title:
The type of the email address.
Lookup value from CommunicationType dictionary.
The type can be custom or one of these predefined values:
- home
- work
- other

type.title:
The type of the phone number.
Reference on CommunicationType dictionary.
Used for outbound routing while dialup a phone number.
The type can be custom or one of these predefined values:
- home
- work
- mobile
- homeFax
- workFax
- otherFax
- pager
- workMobile
- workPager
- main
- googleVoice
- other

google.protobuf.NullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

webitel.contacts.AccessMode.title:
- READ: Can `fetch` record. [GET]
 - WRITE: Can `update` record. [PUT|PATCH]
 - DELETE: Can `delete` record. [DELETE]

example.text: This is a new note about the contact's recent activity. So ...

id.description: The unique ID of the Comment. Never changes.

ver.description: Version of the latest update. Numeric sequence.

etag.description:
Unique ID of the latest version of the update.
This ID changes after any update to the underlying value(s).

created_at.description: The user who created this Field.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp(milli) of the last Field update.
Take part in Etag generation.

updated_by.description: The user who performed last Update.

webitel.contacts.Comment.title:
The Contact's internal Comment.
Output purpose only

url.title: REQUIRED. If text[offset:length] is a regular plaintext, NOT an URL itself !

data.text: This is a new note about the contact's recent activity. So ...
This contact may become a customer in a few days

app.description:
App (Text-Gateway) used to connect the IM client.
Id will be internal id of gateway.
Name will be name of the gateway.

protocol.description: Protocol used to connect the IM client.

primary.description: Indicates whether this phone number is default within other channels of the same type(phone).

verified.title:
Indicate whether Contact, as a Person, realy owns this associated phone number.
In other words: whether Contact is reachable thru this 'email' communication channel ?

type.title:
The type of the email address.
Lookup value from CommunicationType dictionary.
The type can be custom or one of these predefined values:
- home
- work
- other

webitel.contacts.InputEmailAddress.description: Input of the Contact's email address.

created_by.description: Id of Agent created this IM client.

gateway_id.description: App (Text-Gateway) used to connect the IM client.

via.description: [Via] App(-specific) peer(-id) to connect[from] the IM client.

webitel.contacts.InputIMClient.description: Input of the contact IM client.

etag.description: Unique ID of the latest version of an existing resorce.

label.description:
REQUIRED. Hashtag value;
NOTE: Keep in mind, hashtags are not case-sensitive,
but adding capital letters does make them easier to read:
#MakeAWish vs. #makeawish.

webitel.contacts.InputLabel.description:
A Contact's associated Tag.
Output purpose only.

etag.description: Unique ID of the latest version of an existing association.

primary.description:
Indicates whether this association must be default
among others of the same type.

tag.title:
NEW, well-formed IETF BCP 47 language tag representing the locale.
https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/bcp47

webitel.contacts.InputLanguage.description: An input of the Contact's language.

etag.description: Unique ID of the latest version of an existing resource.

primary.description: Indicates whether this association must be default among others.

verified.description: Indicate whether Contact, as a Person, realy owns this associated name.

given_name.title:
OPTIONAL. Given name(s) or first name(s) of the End-User.
Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple given names;
all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.
https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#StandardClaims #given_name

middle_name.description:
OPTIONAL. Middle name(s) of the End-User.
Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names;
all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.
Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.

family_name.title:
OPTIONAL. Surname(s) or last name(s) of the End-User.
Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name;
all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.
https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#StandardClaims #family_name

common_name.description:
REQUIRED. End-User's full name in displayable form
including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes,
ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.

etag.description: Unique ID of the latest version of an existing resorce.

primary.description: Indicates whether this phone number is default within other channels of the same type(phone).

verified.title:
Indicate whether Contact, as a Person, realy owns this associated phone number.
In other words: whether Contact is reachable thru this 'phone' communication channel ?

type.title:
The type of the phone number.
Reference on CommunicationType dictionary.
Used for outbound routing while dialup a phone number.
The type can be custom or one of these predefined values:
- home
- work
- mobile
- homeFax
- workFax
- otherFax
- pager
- workMobile
- workPager
- main
- googleVoice
- other

webitel.contacts.InputPhoneNumber.description: Input of the contact phone number.

etag.description: Unique ID of the latest version of an existing association.

primary.description: True if the photo is a default photo; false if the photo is a user-provided photo.

photo_url.title:
The URL of the photo.
You can change the desired size by appending
a query parameter sz={size} at the end of the url,
where {size} is the size in pixels.
Example: https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-T_wVWLlmg7w/AAAAAAAAAAI/AAAAAAAABa8/00gzXvDBYqw/s100/photo.jpg?sz=50

etag.description: Unique ID of the latest version of an existing resource.

primary.description: Indicates whether this association must be default among others.

webitel.contacts.InputTimezone.description: An input of the Contact's timezones.

etag.description: Unique ID of the latest version of an existing resorce.

id.description: The unique ID of the association. Never changes.

ver.description: Version of the latest update. Numeric sequence.

etag.description:
Unique ID of the latest version of the update.
This ID changes after any update to the underlying value(s).

created_at.description: The user who created this Field.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp(milli) of the last Field update.
Take part in Etag generation.

updated_by.description: The user who performed last Update.

label.description:
REQUIRED. Tag value;
NOTE: Keep in mind, hashtags are not case-sensitive,
but adding capital letters does make them easier to read:
#MakeAWish vs. #makeawish.

webitel.contacts.Label.description:
A Contact's associated Tag.
Output purpose only.

next.title:
Indicates that this is a partial result.
More data available upon query: ?size=${data.len}&page=${page++}

webitel.contacts.LabelList.description:
LabelList dataset.
NOTE: Edge represents connection between two nodes.
So this ContactLabels.data are always subordinate to some contact.id.

webitel.contacts.LabelTags.description: LabelTags dataset list of label's info.

Indicates whether this association is the default
among others of the same type.

tag.title:
The well-formed IETF BCP 47 language tag representing the locale.
https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/bcp47

webitel.contacts.Language.description:
A Contact's locale preference.
Output purpose only.

data.description: Page of the Contact's Language(s) dataset.

page.description: Page number of partial result dataset records.

next.title:
Next indicate whether there are more result records(page+) available.
If set - next page is available with query ?size=$(data.length)&page=$(page++)

LabelsData
NOTE: Edge represents connection between two nodes.
So this ContactLabels.data are always subordinate to some contact.id.

Simplified search filter to uniquely identify related object.

webitel.contacts.Name.description:
A contact's name.
If the name is a mononym, the family name is empty.

Inspired:
https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#StandardClaims
https://developers.google.com/people/api/rest/v1/people#name
